title: Positive, Negative or Zero
description: Write a C program that takes an integer as input and prints whether it is 'Positive', 'Negative', or 'Zero'.
constraints: Input integer will be between -1000 and 1000.

title: Even or Odd
description: Write a C program that takes an integer as input and determines if it is 'Even' or 'Odd'.
constraints: Input integer will be between -1000 and 1000.

title: Largest of Two Numbers
description: Write a C program that takes two integers as input and prints the 'Largest number' among them. If both are equal, print 'Both are equal'.
constraints: Input integers will be between -500 and 500.

title: Grading System (If-Else If)
description: Write a C program that takes an integer `score` (0-100) as input. Assign and print a grade based on the following: 'A' (90-100), 'B' (80-89), 'C' (70-79), 'D' (60-69), 'F' (below 60).
constraints: Score will be an integer between 0 and 100.

title: Vowel or Consonant
description: Write a C program that reads a single lowercase English alphabet character. Determine if it is a 'Vowel' (a, e, i, o, u) or a 'Consonant'.
constraints: Input will be a single lowercase English alphabet character.

title: Leap Year Checker
description: Write a C program that takes a year (integer) as input and determines if it is a 'Leap Year' or 'Not a Leap Year'. A leap year is divisible by 4, but not by 100, unless it is also divisible by 400.
constraints: Input year will be between 1900 and 2100.

title: Simple Calculator using Switch
description: Write a C program that takes two floating-point numbers and a character operator (+, -, *, /) as input. Use a `switch` statement to perform the corresponding arithmetic operation and print the result. Handle division by zero.
constraints: Numbers between -100.0 and 100.0. Operator is one of '+', '-', '*', '/'.

title: Quadratic Equation Roots
description: Write a C program to find the roots of a quadratic equation `ax^2 + bx + c = 0`, where `a`, `b`, and `c` are floating-point inputs. Handle three cases: real and distinct roots, real and equal roots, and complex roots. Print the roots accordingly, formatted to two decimal places.
constraints: Coefficients `a`, `b`, `c` between -100.0 and 100.0. `a` will not be zero.
sampleOutput:
Roots are real and distinct:
Root 1 = 2.00
Root 2 = 1.00

title: Ternary Operator Practice
description: Write a C program that reads two integers, `x` and `y`. Using only the ternary operator (`? :`), determine and print the maximum of the two numbers. Then, use the ternary operator again to print 'Even' or 'Odd' if `x` is even or odd, respectively.
constraints: Input integers will be between -500 and 500.

title: Cinema Ticket Price Calculator
description:
Write a C program that calculates the ticket price for a cinema based on age and movie type. Take `age` (integer) and `movie_type` (character: 'R' for Regular, 'P' for Premium) as input. Apply these rules:
- Age < 12: $5.00 (Regular), $8.00 (Premium)
- Age >= 12 and Age <= 65: $10.00 (Regular), $15.00 (Premium)
- Age > 65: $7.00 (Regular), $12.00 (Premium)
Print the calculated ticket price formatted to two decimal places.
